definition: to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length
to close/to stop/to put a stop to sth/cut-off point/stopping point/deadline
entirely different/different as black and white
to intercept/to cut off and capture
(of a newspaper) to stop accepting incoming articles
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to cut off a section of sth
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way

sentences.english: An intercepting panel is arranged on the circumference of the light outlet of the reflector.
sentences.chinese: 所述反射器的出光口的周向設有截光板。

sentences.english: How can be used in IE5 screen truncation source download?
sentences.chinese: 哪有能在IE5下使用的屏幕截詞源碼下載？

sentences.english: Just wanted open jaws promise, but drive autumn son the beginning mow for half path.
sentences.chinese: 剛要開口答應，卻被秋子初給半道截了去。

sentences.english: If I follow this slope up to here, it'll intercept somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 如果我按這個斜率上升到這，它會被截在某處。

sentences.english: He cut the rope then and went astern to noose the tail.
sentences.chinese: 然後他割下一截繩子，走到船梢去套住魚尾巴。

sentences.english: All accounts are billed up to a pre-determined cut-off date, on actual and projected electricity charges.
sentences.chinese: 所有賬戶的實際及預期電費均計算至設定的截數日期。

sentences.english: The roots are extracted in the root sections by method of bisection or secant.
sentences.chinese: 採用二分區間求根法或弦截求根法確定故障點。

sentences.english: Twice Yao failed to meet entry passes and the ball was stolen away.
sentences.chinese: 有兩次姚明沒能接住傳球，於是球被抄截了。

sentences.english: The telegram will intercep him at Paris.
sentences.chinese: 這封電報將把他截在巴黎。

definition: at the base/at the root/(of a leg) just below the crutch
document folded in accordion form/to fold
thick and thin/coarse and fine/thickness (caliber)/coarseness/quality of work
to peel with a knife/to pare/to cut (a ball at tennis etc)
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
(hitting) squarely in the middle/(slicing) across the middle/to hold by the waist
to split/to crack/to break open/to rend
